review_title: Friends Village at Woodstown is one organization that makes every effort to live their values.
pros: In all that takes place the care of the Residents/Patients always comes first. Like many organizations Friends Village faces the challenges and pressures of a rapidly changing Healthcare environment. In my experience Friends Village is far ahead of similar facilities with respect to leveraging technology in order to improve Resident/Patient care.
cons: At times, change can be a challenge. With a good track record on staff retention there are opportunities to provide further guidance and/or encourage greater participation in the organizations excellent Tuition Reimbursement program.

review_title: Not a nice play to work
job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Woodstown, NJ
pros: nothing was good about working here,
cons: everything including staffing, pay, management was messed up

pros: This is a Good job for high schoolers or for someone who needs an easy part time job. The residents are wonderful.
cons: The Normal work clicks and gossip. Sometimes favoritism towards some. Expects a lot from you for the little pay wage

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Woodstown, NJ
cons: Lazy Management, protecting their own. Sneaky behind your back people.  Some people live on their phones and other get in trouble for talking to co-workers.  Upper management comes and go as they please.  Some of them are never in the building, but then management penny pinches the people who do the work in the building.

job_title: Front Desk Receptionist in Woodstown, NJ
pros: Great and friendly residents, and security staff.
cons: The cleanliness of the facility is below standards. Rehab equipment is never cleaned properly, and the Kitchen never receives anything above a C for health inspection.
